meanings.definition: The power to produce a desired result or effect.
meanings.sent1: Her effectuality in solving problems impressed everyone in the team.
meanings.sent2: The effectuality of the new medicine in treating the illness was remarkable.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand had an unexpected effectuality in making objects disappear.
meanings.sent4: The effectuality of her leadership was like a beacon guiding the team through challenges.
meanings.sent5: The effectuality of the sunscreen was evident as it protected her skin from sunburn.

meanings.definition: The quality of being effective or successful.
meanings.sent1: The effectuality of his speech persuaded many to support the cause.
meanings.sent2: She demonstrated great effectuality in managing the project efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The cat's effectuality in catching mice made it the hero of the house.
meanings.sent4: The effectuality of his plan was akin to a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The effectuality of the team's collaboration was evident in the successful completion of the task.
